However, theyre not the only ones: it turns out every kid in Elmore is competing to get Masami the perfect present. When Gumball and Darwin decide to think outside the box, their unusual gift is a big surprise, but not a good one.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball decides that the best way to prove to Mr. Fitzgerald that hes good enough for Penny is to become his apprentice for the day. The problem is, Mr. Fitzgerald has an important interview and Gumballs enthusiastic attempts to help him might actually do more harm than good, both to Mr. Fitzgeralds business and to Gumballs future with Penny.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Grandpa Louie gives them a cheque, the Watterson kids argue over how to spend the money. / When they find Anais training herself for a brutal showdown Gumball and Darwin realise that their sister is being pestered at school by an annoying kid: Billy. / An impromptu hug with a stranger at school leaves Gumball in an increasingly awkward social situation. / Mom and the kids depart for their hard days work leaving a seemingly lazy Dad half-asleep on the sofa. programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Darwin taunts Gumball about how predictable he is, Gumball tries to prove that he can still surprise his buddy. He thinks that greeting a kid he barely knows with a hug will do the trick. Hes right, Darwin doesnt see it coming. But what Gumball doesnt see coming is the awkward social repercussions of the hug...

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball and Darwin are devastated to learn that Mr Robinson - their favourite person in the world - is selling his house and leaving town. When they realise that making some final happy memories with Mr Robinson is not enough for them, they decide to stop him leaving, by sabotaging the sale.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Mr Corneille shows up to work with a mysterious bruise, Gumball and Darwin discover that hes teacher by day and a cage fighter by night, or was until he vowed never to fight again. However when the school is being closed for a lack of finances the boys have to try and convince him to come out retirement for one last fight.

Their journey becomes increasingly awkward until a delusional mall cop tries to arrest them and in the process allows them to finally go their separate ways…

If Gumball and Darwin do Tobias chores they can earn his "good points" and use them for Galatrek. Gumball and Darwin think theyve hit the jackpot. programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Its Irmas birthday. Bean buys a bargain-bin load of cards, and writes out two - one nice, one silly. He gets his envelopes mixed up and sends off the wrong card. programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean breaks his bed using it as a trampoline. He tries to fix it, but he cant. Next morning, and after an awful nights sleep, he goes to buy a brand-new bed. He has fun trying all the beds out, but the one he wants is too expensive. He is about to get thrown out of the shop when he turns his experience of all the beds to his advantage.

programme.title: Mr Bean

Chased by the irate Receptionist, Bean gets more than he bargained for when he crashes into Mrs. Wickets massage session.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Bean is both cajoled by Irma and spurred by his own jealousy of the fund-raising super-star Declan into raising money for the local donkey sanctuary. He tries to thwart Declans success and increase the amount of money hes raising until eventually he finds himself challenging Declan to a sky-diving competition.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Tana korraldab seenerahvas suure oksaralli ja Seenepapi naitab end ootamatust kuljest.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Tana valvavad Mikk-Mikk ja sõbrad nupsude jarele.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: The Mushlets love Mush-Mushs heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he cant back out - and so ends up stuck up a cliff. Relieved to be rescued by Chep and Lilit, Mush-Mush is about to admit that he isnt a hero when the Mushlets find themselves in danger. Now Mush-Mush has no choice but to be a real hero!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings improvise a trampoline with bagpipes, only each jump is accompanied by a deafening outburst. Grizzy steps in and hurls the object far from the castle. The rodents catch up with it on a mystical nearby isle, where they meet five fairies. One of them breathes life into the musical instrument. The Lemmings return to the castle with five sets of enchanted pipes and catapult Grizzy far away. Its his turn to discover the mysterious isle.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy puts a stop to the Lemmings furious rodeo game on a sheep. Annoyed, they decide to banish the bear to the bottom of the castle dungeons while hes taking a nap. In his prison, Grizzy finds a magic shepherds crook. Now he can direct the neighboring sheep according to his desires. With their help, he manages to escape from his dungeon. He returns to the cabin and settles in on the flock like on a sofa, while the Lemmings stare in disbelief!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: While fighting over a jelly cake, Grizzy banishes the Lemmings to the castle dungeons and the rodents discover a passageway leading to a secret elfin room. The Lemmings activate a secret mechanism, transforming their surroundings into a "heroic fantasy" world where they are elves, the sheep are goblins, and Grizzy is a magician. The jelly cake battle now takes on epic dimensions!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings take Polaroid snapshots of themselves disguised outside the castle along with a sheep who poses with them. But smelling the scent of Grizzys cookies in the cabin, the sheep abandons them. The bears heart is softened by the little ball of wool and consents to share (some of) his snack. He pampers the creature and grows fond of it, but the rodents want their pal back!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy is pulled out of his dreams by the rambunctious Lemmings who are jousting on sheep. The sly bear gets rid of the rodents by enticing their mounts away with food. Irritated, the Lemmings scheme to remove the bear from the castle during his nap and prevent him from ever returning. Furious at being banished, the bear prepares his revenge, armed with a catapult.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: With a ring that lets their astral bodies travel, the Lemmings decide to haunt Grizzy.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over a giant jelly cake. Their chase leads them to the castle library, where the Lemmings accidentally activate the opening of a secret passage. The hidden room conceals numerous volumes of magic books. When opened, each book makes the story content or characters appear in real life. The bear and the rodents covet the same work: one with dessert recipes!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy chases the Lemmings throughout the castle to swipe the delicious jelly cake they were about to eat. He locks them inside a closet and makes off with the dessert. In the closet, the rodents discover a card that enables them to teleport the magic piece of furniture. They free themselves and recover the cake out from under the stunned bears nose. Grizzy understands that hes been tricked, but will he let things go at that?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: When Mr. Bean finds a fly in his room, its war. He needs weapons. Fly spray? A rolled-up magazine? These are only the start. In desperation, he enlists a mouldy doughnut, an encyclopaedia, an upside-down dustbin and a club-hammer. Finally, Bean becomes the first man in history to wage war on a fly... with a fridge.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: A leisurely stroll in the park turns into a run when Mr. Bean is chased home by an angry Mime Artist. He is lost for more words than usual when the street performer makes himself at home and insists on being wined and dined. Bean ousts the pest from his house using the only language mime artists understand.

programme.title: Mr Bean

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Its a beautiful day at the beach. Bean breathes in the salty air, bliss - and not another soul in sight. What could possibly spoil his perfect day? Answer: British weather. Mr. Bean finds himself chasing an illusive ray of sunshine across town, over hills and dales, a football stadium and the English Channel.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is shocked when Teddy receives a birthday card from Beans girlfriend, Irma Gobb. The bears Birthday had completely slipped his mind. And what do you get for the teddy that has everything? A morning in a toy shop, burgers for lunch and a slap up tea party, of course. (But only if you can afford it.)

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans landlady is hopping mad on finding molehills on her lovely croquet lawn. Bean looks to get hammered if he does not rid the old lady of the cuddly little half-blind culprit. He fails dismally with his eccentric mole extermination methods and ends up simply taking the pesky rodent for a ride.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans tranquillity is shattered by deafening roadworks outside his bedroom window. Threats, sabotage and subterfuge all fail to quell the cacophony until Bean has the ingenious idea of feeding the workmen into peaceful submission. But the silence ends with a bang!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean likes nothing more than to relax on his sofa with a good meal and his favourite telly programme. Unfortunately, a painful explosion of springs under his bottom puts an end to that. He sets about buying another one… but, alas, sofas are expensive items. TV dinners may well be a thing of the past for Mr Bean.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr. Bean. Mr. Bean finds a treasure map in a dark and cobwebby corner of his attic, but its tricky clues lead him up the chimney, round the bend, down the garden path, up the blinking wall and nearly all the way to Australia!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: After a regrettable episode involving his landlady sleepwalking into his room, Mr. Bean suddenly finds himself out on his ear with nowhere to live. Near to tears, he yearns for the cosy familiarity of his old home. A scarecrow and a pair of false teeth come to his rescue.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: An old photo album causes Bean to reminisce about his lovely summers at scout camp as a boy, and sets him planning a night under the stars with Teddy. Purchasing a tent becomes a tricky problem - but nothing will stop him having a good time, even if he has to get the garden shed over the roof of his house.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr. Bean. When his model aeroplane is blown out of the sky by a rival childs plane, Mr. Bean sets his sights on revenge - when the next day comes, his newly-constructed fighter plane is almost ready for take-off, but it lacks a vital part and the local model shop is shut! This doesnt matter, though - soon the plane is chocks away with Teddy at the controls and fighting for airspace over London N10.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: When Mr. Bean breaks his favourite Royal mug he discovers theres only one place to buy a replacement: Buckingham Palace, home of the Queen of England. When one of Her Majestys corgis runs off with his teddy, Bean gives chase through secret tunnels… and gets lost.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean finds himself lumbered with an unwanted pet in the form of a four-legged ball of pink fur with piggy eyes and a penchant for earthworms. Encyclopedias leave him none the wiser as to the identity of the pesky creature but Bean cant bring himself to just abandon it. The puzzle is eventually solved after a picnic in the park and a raid on the local pet shop.

programme.desc: Grizzy has got it into his head to offer a butterfly to the she-bear hes in love with. But the Lemmings fight with him over the rare specimens hes spotted, for they want to play helicopter. The butterfly hunt is on!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry

programme.desc: The Lemmings find a pack of icy mints that literally chill your breath. One blast from anyone who eats them freezes everything in sight. Grizzy does not particularly care for this frosty ambiance and tries to take their candy away.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy cant believe it: he has just swallowed a spoonful of his favorite food, chocolate spread, and he hates it! How could that be possible? And yet, when he swiped the jar from the Lemmings, they seemed to be enjoying it immensely. A quick investigation reveals that the Lemmings added a dash of lemon juice to the jar to give the spread a sharper taste. And they intend to jazz up the rest of the stock as well!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the fondness of his beloved she-bear for meditation. To seduce her, he sets out to prove to her that he too can attain the Zen attitude. programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a super-secret Canadian Army prototype which resembles a simple computer keyboard. It has only several command keys: select, cut and paste, and delete, but the keys act directly on surrounding elements... as well as on living beings!

When the police show no interest in his campaign Bean builds a homemade vacuuming contraption causing chaos and mayhem wherever he goes.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is very scared on a stormy night and even more so when he hears Mrs Wicket screaming from downstairs. Mr Bean investigates and finds the source of the problem...a rat! Mr Bean offers to help Mrs Wicket rid their house of the troublesome rodent. The only problem is the crafty rat is going nowhere fast and is always one step ahead. Mr Bean looks to inspiration from the Pied Piper but fairy stories dont always have happy endings.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean decides to do something romantic on Valentines Day for his long-suffering girlfriend Irma. But while he is secretly delivering her valentines card Mr Bean finds out he has a love rival for Irmas attention. Bean steps up his efforts and takes Irma on a "date" to the Valentines Fair only to find his love rival is there too! But will the fortune-tellers prediction be the ticket to a happy ending?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean has forgotten hes supposed to be cooking dinner for his long-suffering girlfriend Irma. He dashes to the supermarket to buy some groceries but why buy food when you can win an entire trolley full in an All You Can Eat Competition? But Mr Bean has some stiff competition - no one can eat one of Mr Maggs pies quicker than Mr Maggs himself. Mr Bean has to think fast to win. But after all that eating will Bean still be in the mood to cook a romantic meal?

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy watches a documentary on salmon, whereas the Lemmings want to dance it up in the garage, nightclub style. TV versus music, the sonic war has begun! When a cloud passes overhead, Grizzy realizes that their respective gadgets run on electricity provided by solar panels. No more sun, no more electricity! He devises a plan whereby he will be the only one to access the energy, but the Lemmings have not said their last word!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A confrontation between Grizzy and the Lemmings leads to a room in the castle tower. The bear accidentally sets off a mechanism and discovers a large medieval magic trunk. Indeed, when placed inside, the trunk can blend two objects into one! The Lemmings are quicker and get their hands on the trunk, then set out to play with objects they have enhanced. But its Grizzy who discovers the formula that makes you ultra-powerful.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: When the Lemmings spoil Grizzys meal with their new game, the bear evicts them far from the cabin. They crash onto a faraway picnic table. All except one, who bounces off some jelly pudding which was left behind. When the Lemmings discover its highly spongy texture, they invent a whole bunch of new bouncing games. But Grizzy, starving and dinner-deprived, has his eyes on the dessert!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings are holding a log throwing competition that stops short when Grizzy sends them soaring into the distance. The rodents land upon an ancient Celtic site where they happen upon a magic bracelet that increases the strength of whoever wears it tenfold. The Lemmings start the competition over with their new power, only this time using menhirs! A witness to the scene, Grizzy longs for the magic object and imagines everything he could do with the piece of jewelry.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over the TV remote control. The argument leads the bear to the summit of the castle tower during a storm. In a secret room, he glimpses a human form by the light of a lightning bolt. Terrified, Grizzy unwittingly sets off a mechanism which had been activated by the lightning, and which brings to life a medieval armor. The living armor bows before the flabbergasted bear. Grizzy has just found a docile and fearsome ally with whom to combat the Lemmings!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a whale of a time revamping the paintings on display in the castle by painting themselves alongside the illustrated noblemen. But Grizzy wants to paint himself on the next painting and swipes the artwork along with the rodents paint kit. The furious Lemmings are determined to recover their material at all costs. Its the beginning of a dispute that could be qualified as… artsy!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings improvise a trampoline with bagpipes, only each jump is accompanied by a deafening outburst. Grizzy steps in and hurls the object far from the castle. The rodents catch up with it on a mystical nearby isle, where they meet five fairies. One of them breathes life into the musical instrument. The Lemmings return to the castle with five sets of enchanted pipes and catapult Grizzy far away. Its his turn to discover the mysterious isle.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: The Batwheels face off with the Legion of Zoom as they attempt to recover Batmans stolen cowl from the villainous vehicles.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Its the battle of the moustaches when Tom accidentally drinks a hair tonic potion left behind by Jerry - and Butch realizes he needs to acquire some facial hair of his own if he is to compete for Toodles and Dollfaces attentions.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry fight each other with the balloons that Rick has placed all over the house.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: When Tom and Jerrys antics unearth an autographed baseball a childhood souvenir of Ricks he warns Tom to keep his paws off it or else! Tom attempts to obey but Jerrys got other ideas and the ball gets out of hand. The guys chase the treasured ball all over the neighborhood recovering it only to lose it again and again.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: When Tom sits in Frankensteins lab seat, he gets transformed into a colossus with his miracle growth potion.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom finds himself trapped inside a Catsylvania bedtime story and fleeing from a furious Jabberwock.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: An evil ringmaster recruits Tom to help him snare the Catsylvania mice.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Irma wants a romantic break; Bean doesnt. Its too expensive. Irma kidnaps Teddy and refuses to give him back unless Bean promises to take her to Paris. Caught between his inability to pay and his love of Teddy Bean doesnt know what to do! Until he spots a cat beauty competition in which first prize is a romantic break in Paris - if only he can catch Scrapper …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Bean wants to avoid lunch with Irmas Mum at all costs. He persuades Mrs. Wicket to let him join her on a coach trip to a concert - but he has to disguise himself as an old-aged pensioner or he wont be allowed on the coach. Once on the coach Bean drives everyone mad with his anti-boredom antics.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Bean is showing Irma his favourite tree in the park one day when he discovers a tree surgeon getting ready to cut it down. He darts up the tree and wont come back down. Irma loves this new side of Bean-ey! The tree surgeon is frustrated and tries various ploys to get Bean down. But can Bean make it to the toilet without being discovered and still save that tree?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket is persuaded by a jaunty estate agent to put her house up for sale. Bean is distraught - where will he live? Not Mrs. Wickets problem. Bean decides to hi-jack the sales process in order to deter all potential buyers - even if it means turning the whole house upside down!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Porky Pig uses his steamroller to flatten and make sure every build is "Porky Perfect" in this music video.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A magic tomahawk divides Grizzy into two identical bears with diametrically opposite personalities, one short-tempered, the other super-sweet. The Lemmings, who did not witness Grizzys split, will have a hard time working out the behavior of their usual enemy, who seems to swing from excessive kindness to the worst trickery for no reason.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: After studying a magazine advertisement with a couple standing in front of an SUV, Grizzy imagines that if only he had a nice car, his favorite she-bear would be interested in him. He decides to confiscate the Lemmings crate on wheels and give it a serious overhaul. The Lemmings have nothing against an upgrade, as long as they remain behind the wheel!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: While chasing the Lemmings, who stole his jar of chocolate spread, Grizzy crashes into an arcade cabinet near the supermarket which displays a model fortuneteller and her crystal ball. Grizzy realizes that he can foresee events that are going to happen to him in the crystal ball, and namely the traps that the Lemmings have planned for him.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A newly unpacked UV tanning booth holds the place of honor in the middle of the cabin. Grizzy gets it into his head that a classy tan will help him draw the attention of the she-bear hes enamored with. When he opens the box, he discovers that the Lemmings have beat him to it and are already playing "beach party" inside the bed.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have turned the entire cabin topsy-turvy to organize medieval jousts with the rangers fencing gear. Grizzy who wishes to recover his couch tries to straighten up but is driven out by their fencing foils. To retaliate Grizzy must find a blade equal to the task. He opts for a fine frozen swordfish!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A strange object is delivered to the Rangers cabin: an over-board! Its a latest generation skateboard which levitates above the ground without wheels. The Lemmings immediately try to get their paws on it, but Grizzy also covets the board as a table to set his TV-dinners down on.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover the joys of photography with the rangers instant print camera. Grizzy would like to make a beautiful artistic portrait of the she-bear hes in love with whereas the Lemmings prefer a group photo with a face-making competition: two radically opposed artistic trends!

programme.title: Tom and Jerry
programme.desc: Tom is up to his usual nonsense, but two can play at this game as they take their chase into the neighbourhood. Leave it to Jerry to turn the tables on Tom!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Animated adventure series for younger viewers that follows a team of five superpowered vehicles - Bam, Redbird, Bibi, Batwing and Buff - as they are thrust into hijinks and action while learning important lessons about teamwork, friendship, and so much more helping Batman, Robin and Batgirl defend Gotham City. When the Batwheels mysteriously disappear, Bam enlists the help of A.D.A.M. - the original Batmobile - to help save his friends.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Animated adventure series for younger viewers that follows a team of five superpowered vehicles - Bam, Redbird, Bibi, Batwing and Buff - as they are thrust into hijinks and action while learning important lessons about teamwork, friendship, and so much more helping Batman, Robin and Batgirl defend Gotham City. Bam is secretly afraid of the dark - much to everyones surprise - but he must conquer his fears if he is to stop Poison Ivy.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Animated adventure series for younger viewers that follows a team of five superpowered vehicles - Bam, Redbird, Bibi, Batwing and Buff - as they are thrust into hijinks and action while learning important lessons about teamwork, friendship, and so much more helping Batman, Robin and Batgirl defend Gotham City. When Redbird tries his hand at espionage as V-8 the Super-Spy, he quickly realises that he has gotten in way over his head.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Animated adventure series for younger viewers that follows a team of five superpowered vehicles - Bam, Redbird, Bibi, Batwing and Buff - as they are thrust into hijinks and action while learning important lessons about teamwork, friendship, and so much more helping Batman, Robin and Batgirl defend Gotham City. Bibi doesnt think that she can help Batgirl any more when she has a terrible no-good day where she keeps messing up and lets Joker get away.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Sunny Seagull hires The Looney Builders to build a carnival on Looneyburgs pier.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders take turns distracting Petunia as they build her a big surprise birthday cake in the back yard.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders build a float to lead the Flower Parade, but Porky wont settle for anything less than Porky Perfect.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of Bugs Bunny and his friends in this Halloween special episode.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: The Great Eduardo, violinist supreme, is in town and Irma wants to go to the concert. But Bean wont pay for the tickets. More than that, he claims that he can play the violin better. Now he has to prove it. After a lot of painful sawing, even Eduardo cant bear the noise. He offers to teach Bean, who ends up replacing him in the concert!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Miss Wince takes Mrs. Wicket off on holiday in her brand-new, swanky caravan; and Bean is left behind. But never one to let a setback knock his confidence, he decides to build his own caravan and sets off in search of the perfect quiet spot. All would be well if hed only not built the caravan out of Mrs. Wickets garden shed …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is trying to impress some kids in the park with his football skills but winds up kicking their ball into a dilapidated, scary-looking house. He has to go in and get it back. A feral cat living inside decides to steal Teddy, and in the chase around the insides of the house Bean manages something not even a wrecking ball can do.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean accidentally spills all of Mrs. Wickets new, expensive perfume on the floor. In an attempt to hide his crime and refill the empty bottle, he tries to recreate the smell - by adding all sorts of odd and strange ingredients. He might be able to fool Mrs. Wicket, but can he fool Scrapper and all the neighbourhood cats?

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Chanterelle has built a whistle that can reproduce the most beautiful sound of the forest: the one of the Nightingale. When the whistle disappears, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit soon discover that it has been stolen by a beetle. In order to finally hear what a real Nightingale sounds like, theyll have to get it back!

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers - a job that takes time and care. Soon Mush-Mushs haste causes disaster when he scares all the bees away. Now Mush-Mush and friends have to find a way to lure the bees back…

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Tana aitavad Lilit, Kubarapoiss ja Mikk-Mikk Tossul hirmust võitu saada.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Seenemikud nuputavad, kuidas mao kaest Liliti lendav taldrik katte saada.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.sub-title: The Bear, the Frog and the Mosquito
programme.desc: The Lemmings have fun bouncing off the backs of harmless green frogs while Grizzy chases some mosquitos buzzing around him in vain. / Grizzy comes home to the cabin and discovers the super fired-up Lemmings dancing madly to the sound of the ghetto blaster. / A confrontation between Grizzy and the Lemmings leads to a room in the castle tower. The bear accidentally sets off a mechanism and discovers a large medieval magic trunk.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy comes home to the cabin and discovers the super fired-up Lemmings dancing madly to the sound of the ghetto blaster. The Lemmings are thrown out into the jungle where they meet a parrot that can reproduce any sound identically. The bird becomes their ally to distract Grizzy and recover their musical equipment, but the mission foils and the gadget breaks. A microprocessor falls out and sticks to the bird, who starts picking up musical waves!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Straddling bats, the Lemmings organize an obstacle course in the pitch-dark cabin. When Grizzy comes home, he panics and switches on the lights. The night creatures immediately hang from the ceiling and fall asleep. When Grizzy ejects the Lemmings from the cabin, they crash onto an Incan temple where they discover a spheric object that can control the Earths rotation. The Lemmings plunge the jungle into deep dark night and wake up their mounts.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings get hold of an old pinball machine and install it in the cabin. Their furious party interrupts Grizzys nap and the bear threatens to break the contraption. The rodents lock the bear in the garage, but he finds a way to escape and gets rid of both the game and its players. Propelled into the jungle, the Lemmings fall on a rubber tree. When they discover its bouncing properties, they decide to make a giant pinball in the middle of the trees!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy, a big chocolate lover, is growing a young cacao tree under an ultraviolet lamp. During a trampoline session, the Lemmings accidentally break the lamp, provoking a supernatural reaction. One of them is transformed into a Super Lemming who makes any plant he touches turn into a giant. Grizzy imagines the huge pods his cocoa tree would produce if it were to become giant too.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: During a fight, Grizzy and the Lemmings stumble upon a Mayan temple lost in the jungle. Once inside, they set off a magic reaction that creates doubles of themselves at different ages. They now have a Grizzy babe and elderly Lemmings. Grizzy tries to get the young bear interested in a documentary on salmon, while the Lemmings want to initiate their ancestors to dance. But age differences are not so easily defeated.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Short on food supplies, Grizzy has gone out to gather fruit. He comes back with a basketful but discovers that the Lemmings have stolen the last helping of Yummy chocolate spread in the cabin. A fight breaks out. The rodents are thrown out and land in a dugout canoe filled with traditional fishing gear. Armed with blowpipes, they come back to confront Grizzy, who is ejected in turn. In the canoe, the bear discovers a magic blowpipe.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Short on food supplies, Grizzy has gone out to gather fruit. He comes back with a basketful but discovers that the Lemmings have stolen the last of the chocolate spread. / The Lemmings take off with the last jar of Yummy chocolate spread. Grizzy catches up with them but they drop the jar and it lands in a nearby sacred temple. Grizzy and the Lemmings must solve riddles along the path to the Yummy. / Grizzy wakes up after a nap, starving, but the last jar of Yummy chocolate spread is empty. The cupboards are barren, except for a package of chocolate powder.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Its a beautiful day at the beach. Bean breathes in the salty air, bliss - and not another soul in sight. What could possibly spoil his perfect day? Answer: British weather. Mr. Bean finds himself chasing an illusive ray of sunshine across town, over hills and dales, a football stadium and the English Channel.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is shocked when Teddy receives a birthday card from Beans girlfriend, Irma Gobb. The bears Birthday had completely slipped his mind. And what do you get for the teddy that has everything? A morning in a toy shop, burgers for lunch and a slap up tea party, of course. (But only if you can afford it.)

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans landlady is hopping mad on finding molehills on her lovely croquet lawn. Bean looks to get hammered if he does not rid the old lady of the cuddly little half-blind culprit. He fails dismally with his eccentric mole extermination methods and ends up simply taking the pesky rodent for a ride.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans tranquillity is shattered by deafening roadworks outside his bedroom window. Threats, sabotage and subterfuge all fail to quell the cacophony until Bean has the ingenious idea of feeding the workmen into peaceful submission. But the silence ends with a bang!

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Mikk-Mikk ja Lilit puuavad Kubarapoissi veenda, et seenerahva iidsed parimuslood on puhas tõde.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Tana võistlevad Mikk-Mikk ja Kubarapoiss omavahel, kumb tohib olla Tahekubara abiline.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Tana selgitavad Kubarapoiss ja Hiidmikk valja kuulimangu meistri.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Tana õpetab Kukeseenetar Lilitile maalikunsti.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Tana naeme, mis juhtub, kui Kubarapoiss Seenepapi sõna ei kuula.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: After solving a mystery for the Munchkins, Dorothy fancies herself a private eye. She starts solving everyones mysteries from all over Oz. But after pinning her biggest case on the Wicked Witch, she discovers that the Witch has been framed. She must unravel a conspiracy and clear the Witchs good (bad) name!

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: When Dorothy and the gang find out Lion is in the Kingdom of Dreams and might never return, they go to rescue him. But when Lion shows his friends how great it is to live in your dreams, its up to Dorothy to convince him to return to the real world.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Dorothy and her pals must keep a powerful magical relic, the Helmet of Ozmosis, from falling into possession of the Wicked Witch or the Wizard.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: Dorothy and her friends must free Lion from the control of a power-hungry crown that has declared itself King of the Forest.

programme.title: Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: When Dorothy opens a Munchkin Elementary school, Frank and Lyman, tired of being treated like "banana brains," try to sneak in. Meanwhile, Scarecrow gets a big surprise when he discovers a "mini-him" in Munchkin class.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean forgets the golden rule: never fall asleep in the bath when youve got a chicken in the oven. So what romantic meal can he quickly rustle-up for his luckless girlfriend, Irma Gobb? The cheese from the mousetrap? The flower from the vase? A meal is eventually provided by an uninvited guest.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: The nasty tennis player is big and angry and wants his ball back. The one Mr. Bean managed to throw on the roof of a house across the road. Paralysed with vertigo sixty feet up on a windowsill, he is eventually brought to earth by the helpful intervention of a neighbours pet gerbil.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Beans sweet tooth leads him to despair when he bites off a bit more than he can chew. He is tormented by the toothache from Hell - and embarks on a hilarious mission to pull out this menace. Beans DIY attempts fail to succeed, and he is left with no other choice but to visit the dreaded dentist. But can Bean brave the Dentists chair? Or will the dentist despair when faced with Beans antics?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: After (accidentally) rescuing a kitten from a tree Mr. Bean is set to have his picture in the newspaper! The photographer arrives with the grateful lady cat owner, the scene is set, smiles all round…but then disaster strikes when Bean is continually upstaged by… his hair.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but cant escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Beans mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Envious of all the attention his landlady is receiving because of a broken leg, Mr. Bean decides to "break" his leg too. When he ends up in hospital under the care of the Matron from Hell he discovers there are some kinds of attention even he doesnt enjoy.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Whilst trying to redecorate the hall, Bean is obstructed at every turn by his landladys vile one-eyed cat. Bean pops it in the dustbin to keep it out of the way for a while. Just his luck that its rubbish collection day.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Nipping to the shops for a few provisions becomes a nightmare when a mile-long shopping list from his landlady and a clapped out trolley with a wonky wheel conspire to ruin his day. Subscribing to the theory that bigger is better, he constructs his own shopping trolley incorporating a petrol mower, pram wheels and an extra pair of hydraulic hands.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: When nursing an injured magpie in his room, Mr. Bean learns something the rest of us already know: magpies cant help stealing anything that sparkles. When the police arrive to investigate the theft of his landladys jewellery, its not just Mr. Bean that needs to take flight.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: After a head-on collision with the milkman, Mr. Beans landlady is rushed to hospital, leaving him to look after her odious one-eyed cat Scrapper. Fur isnt the only thing that flies and in the end its Bean that needs looking after.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is delighted with his new "ship in a bottle" until it mistakenly ends up on a milkmans float. He frantically pursues his prize possession, only to see it disappear into a milk bottling plant at the local dairy. Getting it back promises to be a mission of the impossible.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: With his teddy bear at the dry cleaners, Mr. Bean finds himself feeling lonely. Fortunately, a new playmate appears in the shape of a goldfish from the garden pond. Bean has a great time with his new best friend until, at the seaside, he discovers that some fish are gigantic, have large pointed teeth and fins on their backs.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is feeling very left out when he discovers that Mrs Wicket is having a huge party downstairs and apparently he isnt invited. Bean tries every trick in the book to sneak himself into the party - even resorting to hiding inside an enormous cake. If only he knew the real reason for the celebration.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Conned by a mechanic into believing his beloved car to be beyond repair, Mr. Bean reluctantly consigns his faithful four-wheeled friend to the car crusher. After choosing hot-air ballooning as an alternative mode of transport, he spots his cherished car from the air… with the unscrupulous mechanic whistling at the wheel! This discovery raises more than Mr. Beans spirits.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans Birthday dinner gets off on the wrong foot when he and Teddy are made to take the worst table at a swanky restaurant. The evening is further ruined by a self-obsessed movie star at the next table. After a swim in the lobster tank, Mr. Bean unwittingly cooks up sweet revenge in the kitchen.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: To Truff, making music comes effortlessly. So when he needs to put in a big effort to make a forest song, it affects him in unusual ways.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas
programme.desc: Lilit loves Chanterelles art so much. But when Chanterelle makes a statue of Lilit, she cant stand it.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider
programme.desc: When Dimples and Weebiscuits tank leaks, they learn to accept change so long as theyre together.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider
programme.desc: Dimples is worried about a toy shark in the aquarium.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider
programme.desc: When Lucas teaches Maizie to paint, she thinks shes no good and needs inspiration.

programme.title: Tom and Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry take their chase to the skies. Kite-flying has never been this intense. Who will emerge as the ultimate master of strings?

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: Mel tries to swing all the way across the monkey bars without any help. Barney lets Mel know hes there just in case she needs him. After a few tries, Mel makes it, and lets Barney know that it was because she knew he was there that she could do it."

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: When Vivies newly-built sandcastle is accidentally destroyed, Barney offers to help her rebuild it using a little magic, but Vivie wants to do it all by herself.Together, they enjoy the process of constructing a new sandcastle from scratch.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: Billy takes us on a tour all around the park while riding his scooter! Follow along as he shows off some of his coolest moves.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Things get crazy down on the farm when a cat and mouse pursuit leads Jerry to hide his turtle egg in a hens nest.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: The Cat and Mouse are hired to find out who absconded with Hoops McJumpalots lucky high top sneakers.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Spike get glued together.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Papa tells his fractured version of the Jack and the Beanstalk story to the Bavarian mouse trio.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: The gang get more than they bargained for when they try to shoo away a seemingly docile spider.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: When Rick and Ginger forget Toms birthday the tomcat moves in with the one person who appreciates him the local Zoos gorilla Cuddles.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings are having a blast with a bowling game they found in the Rangers storeroom. Grizzy hastens to destroy the pins to ensure his peace and quiet. But the Lemmings discover a remote-control device that can modify the balls weight. By setting it on maximum, the ball could knock over much more than pins: furniture, a bear and even a log cabin!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: After the rains, to the great delight of the Lemmings, strange bouncing mushrooms have sprouted in the yard. To put an end to the Lemmings noisy games - which prevent Grizzy from enjoying his peace and quiet - Grizzy tramples the mushrooms. Only to realize that each crushed mushroom frees a cloud of spores that instantly creates… a bunch of identical mushrooms.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have laid hand on special magnets which turn any object they are stuck to into flying objects. Grizzy bears the consequences and is ejected out of the cabin on his couch, which has turned into a flying-couch. Upon landing, Grizzy discovers by chance that the magnet stuck to his forehead enables him to fly like Peter Pan.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: With a lion-tamers whip, a sugar bowl and lots of work, the Lemmings have successfully trained a caribou to go through their obstacle course. Grizzy cannot help but admire the performance. He decides to steal their idea, and the caribou, to create his own circus act and impress his lovely she-bear.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When MOE creates a new, super sparkly vehicle paint, the Batwheels decide to put on a talent show to see who will get a shiny new makeover!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: To ease the burden on MOE, the Batwheels use his duplicating machine to make copies of their repair bot, but the Batcave is soon overrun when the machine breaks!

programme.title: Moley

programme.title: Mr Bean

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Bean discovers Mrs. Wickets nephew and Bruiser Jnr swapping football stickers and decides that he wants to fill up a sticker album too. Bean turns thief to be the best collector of em all.

programme.title: Mikk-Mikk ja seenerahvas

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: When Mel grows frustrated with the things she cant do while wearing a cast, Barney creates an imaginative game for the kids to play. Throughout the game, Mel learns to embrace her abilities with the help of a fantastical robot arm.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: David feels like hes too small to do the all things his big brother can do, so Barney makes him super-sized. But throughout his super-sized adventures David realizes the importance of loving himself just as he is.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Tour the glittering night sky with Batwing, Gothams flying protector with a penchant for posing, as she dips, dives, and dodges through buildings and water to take on villains and bail out a friend or two - set to her funky-fresh theme song.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Super-genius villain Egghead is on the loose, planning to use Gotham Museums famed giant egg to cook up a record-breaking breakfast.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Gothams annual dog show is tonight, and Harley plans to compete for the prized "Best in Show" ribbon. Sensing shes up to no good, Robin decides to enter rough-and-tumble Ace the Bat-Dog to keep an eye on the thieving trickster.

programme.title: Karbikool
programme.desc: The bugs talk about ways to show kindness.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider
programme.desc: The Mighty Boop and Fly Wonder find a lost baby ant. The duo is to the rescue!

programme.title: Lucas the Spider

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: Vivie cant wait to show Barney her new picture -- just as soon as she can find the purple marker she needs to finish it! Barney encourages Vivie to clean up to find it, and Vivie learns that cleaning as you go can help you play!

programme.desc: Its Spikes birthday, but Rick has forgotten about it. Director: Darrell Van Citters,.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: After a particularly rough cat and mouse fight, Jerry quits! Tom is stunned as he watches his little friend storm off to his hole, pack up his belongings and leave. First, Jerry tries moving in next door but thats where Bruno lives. Jerry settles for the house on the other side of his old digs where a rather large, sedentary cat lives. At first, Jerry enjoys his unfettered access to the kitchen but it has its drawbacks: hes constantly having to expand the opening to his new hole because of his weight gain. He first looks to Spike for companionship but that doesnt end well. Then he actively seeks a new mouse-mate, but theres a lot of crazy mice out there, especially one named Mickey. Then Tom and Jerry catch a glimpse of each other through the windows of their adjacent houses. One thing leads to another and the chase thats been happening for decades, continues.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Butch compete for the Golden Fez and chance to be top cat./Hildie and Beatie commemorate the passing of their Mother and Tom tries to help out by bringing her back. / Tom stars in a documentary that mischaracterises his daily activities./ Dr. Bigby latest invention transports Tom and Jerry to Paris where they meet the lovely Gigi and Cozette. / Rick and Ginger are going on a vacation and bringing Tom and Spike aboard the plane./Rick and Ginger sneak Tom and Spike into a hotel where pets are not allowed.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys a new bookcase but it is missing one vital element! / Mr Bean takes Teddy on a seaside holiday but a precocious child decides she should be Teddys best and only friend! / Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean drives her and Miss Wince to their booked spa retreat; and wait outside in the car until theyre done. / Bean is both cajoled by Irma and spurred by his own jealousy of the fund-raising super-star Declan into raising money for the local donkey sanctuary.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean decides to take Teddy on holiday to the seaside. But when he arrives at his hotel a spoilt little girl wants Teddy all for herself. And her protective dad only wants the best for his princess. An on-going tussle ensues between Mr Bean the little girl and her Dad resulting in a chase across the seaside town and onto the pier. No one comes between Mr Bean Teddy and their "relaxing" holiday!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr Bean. Mr Bean is left in peace when Mrs Wicket goes off on her holidays. This means Mr Bean has free access to her daily newspaper. Every time he goes down to collect it from the letterbox it has disappeared. Someone is taking it, but who? Mr Bean is determined to nab the mysterious newspaper stealer and uses a range of ingenious homemade traps in his quest to catch the sneaky thief.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to find a nice quiet place to read his book so he sets off for the Library. But instead of reading he becomes distracted by some funny online videos he sees on the Librarys computer. Before he knows it Mr Bean is recording his own video which is uploaded for everyone to see. Things start to go crazy when people check out his funny video and his popularity takes off. But does Mr Bean enjoy being in the public eye and how long will his celebrity last?

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy puts a stop to the Lemmings furious rodeo game on a sheep. Annoyed, they decide to banish the bear to the bottom of the castle dungeons while hes taking a nap. In his prison, Grizzy finds a magic shepherds crook. Now he can direct the neighboring sheep according to his desires. With their help, he manages to escape from his dungeon. He returns to the cabin and settles in on the flock like on a sofa, while the Lemmings stare in disbelief!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: While fighting over a jelly cake, Grizzy banishes the Lemmings to the castle dungeons and the rodents discover a passageway leading to a secret elfin room. The Lemmings activate a secret mechanism, transforming their surroundings into a "heroic fantasy" world where they are elves, the sheep are goblins, and Grizzy is a magician. The jelly cake battle now takes on epic dimensions!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings take Polaroid snapshots of themselves disguised outside the castle along with a sheep who poses with them. But smelling the scent of Grizzys cookies in the cabin, the sheep abandons them. The bears heart is softened by the little ball of wool and consents to share (some of) his snack. He pampers the creature and grows fond of it, but the rodents want their pal back!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy is pulled out of his dreams by the rambunctious Lemmings who are jousting on sheep. The sly bear gets rid of the rodents by enticing their mounts away with food. Irritated, the Lemmings scheme to remove the bear from the castle during his nap and prevent him from ever returning. Furious at being banished, the bear prepares his revenge, armed with a catapult.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: With a ring that lets their astral bodies travel, the Lemmings decide to haunt Grizzy.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over a giant jelly cake. Their chase leads them to the castle library, where the Lemmings accidentally activate the opening of a secret passage. The hidden room conceals numerous volumes of magic books. When opened, each book makes the story content or characters appear in real life. The bear and the rodents covet the same work: one with dessert recipes!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy chases the Lemmings throughout the castle to swipe the delicious jelly cake they were about to eat. He locks them inside a closet and makes off with the dessert. In the closet, the rodents discover a card that enables them to teleport the magic piece of furniture. They free themselves and recover the cake out from under the stunned bears nose. Grizzy understands that hes been tricked, but will he let things go at that?

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
